intro: Melampyrum vulgatum, commonly known as common touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the family Orobanchaceae, commonly referred to as the broomrape family. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and pairs of opposite leaves that are lance-shaped and often hairy. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Melampyrum vulgatum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including grasslands and woodlands.
